DOC.brief_summary: The study objective evaluate safety effectiveness MicroVention FRED System use treatment wide-necked intracranial aneurysm .
DOC.brief_title: Canadian Study MicroVention Flow Re-Direction ( FRED ) Endoluminal Device Stent System Treatment Intracranial Aneurysms
DOC.criteria: Subject whose age ≥ 18 year ; Subject single target aneurysm locate follow zone : Zone 1 Petrous cavernous ICA Zone 2 Ophthalmic segment ICA Zone 3Posterior Circulation , basilar artery ( include basilar bifurcation ) , vertebral artery Subjects single target intracranial aneurysm locate along internal carotid artery , vertebral basilar artery exist endovascular option ( coil , stentassistedcoiling ) could ineffective aneurysm predispose recurrence due follow characteristic : Aneurysms neck > 4mm , dome neck ratio ≤2 discernible neck Fusiform aneurysm size require treatment ; The parent artery must diameter 2.5 5.0mm distal/proximal target intracranial aneurysm ( IA ) ; Subject fulfill study requirement , subject his/her legally authorized representative provide sign informed consent form ; Negative pregnancy test female subject menses last 24 month ; Subject willing return 1month 6month followup evaluation Subject pregnant breastfeeding ; Subject suffers subarachnoid hemorrhage last 60 day ; Subject suffers intracranial hemorrhage last 30 day ; Subject currently undergo radiation therapy carcinoma sarcoma head neck region ; Subject stenosis parent artery ( > 50 % ) proximal target aneurysm ; Subject know platelet dysfunction contraindication inability tolerate anticoagulants/antiplatelet agent ; Subject contraindication severe allergy anticoagulant antiplatelet medication ( aspirin , heparin , ticlopidine , clopidogrel , prasugrel ticagrelor ) ; Subject know hypersensitivity metal , nickeltitanium metal jewelry Subject document contrast allergy , condition , prohibit image .
